localString.value: This is an oil flask. You may use it to refill a lantern, or try to light it and throw at someone
A flask of acid that can be thrown at enemies.
Alchemist's Fire is a sticky, adhesive substance that ignites on contact with air.
Used as often in the peasant's home as the dungeon's dark, these simple concoctions are common throughout Faerun.
These curative potions are too expensive for most civilians, and are used almost exclusively by soldiers and adventurers.
This is the primary tool thieves use to disarm traps and pick locks
This is a skinning knife. It is not very useful in combat but when used on a corpse can produce hide and meat. Rangers also use it to hunt.
Used as often in the peasant's home as the dungeon's dark, these simple concoctions are common throughout Faerun.
With the power to staunch the flow of blood or knit a broken bone, these potions are in common use among the dangerous professions.
These curative potions are too expensive for most civilians, and are used almost exclusively by soldiers and adventurers.
A flask of acid that can be thrown at enemies.
Alchemist's Fire is a sticky, adhesive substance that ignites on contact with air.
This is a standard lantern, you must refill it with oil every 6 hours of use.
This is an oil flask. You may use it to refill a lantern, or try to light it and throw at someone
This is a standard cheap disposable torch.
This is a bedroll, to use it, drop it on the ground.
This is a bedroll. You can use it by placing it on the ground.
This is a standard food ration
This is a standard food ration
This is the primary tool thieves use to disarm traps and pick locks

Basics of Tailoring Tailoring will require harden hides from tanners. The harden hides are made into colored cloths if used with dyes by a tailor.
Dyes ----- To make clothes you must first Dye Hides from animals. You can use a variety of different colors of dye for a variety of effects.
Hides ----- Hardened medium and large hides can be used in tailoring. You must turn the hides into cloth using dye and the tailors knife.
Cloth ------- There is alot of different kinds of cloth that can be made. Large cloth is used for armor and clothes, and medium cloth is used for everything else.

The stout planks of this bench have been worn smooth by years of use.
The stout planks of this bench have been worn smooth by years of use.
This table allows you to create potions. You will need to have an empty bottle in your inventory and then cast the spell on the lab.
This sturdy blacksmith's anvil bears the dented sheen of long use. Something in you wonders what great weapons and armor have been shaped upon its well-worn surface.
Hearty billows fan the forge-borne flames. The air is blisteringly hot, leaving you feel light-headed and not quite yourself.
Thick metal bands encircle the barrel-planks, ensuring a tight seal.
A portal glows softly before you. You wonder where it leads.
A carefully constructed marker denoting a point of interest.
A portal glows softly before you. You wonder where it leads.
The marker glows with a faint light.
This is a fletchers desk used for making arrows.
A small altar rests before you. Age-old bloodstains have seeped into the stone, mingling with scorchmarks left from a long-extinguished fire.
